oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Eight years of organic farming at Pwllpeiran – livestock production and the financial performance of organic upland
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Frost, David
McLean, Barbara M L
Evans, D Eifion
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Farming Systems
Sheep and goats
Animal husbandry
Beef cattle
Farm economics
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This report was presented at the UK Organic Research 2002 Conference. Established for 8 years, this project evaluates the practicalities of organic beef and sheep production on an upland farm in an ESA. Grassland productivity, stocking rates and animal performance are closely related to seasonal variations in the clover content of the small area of improved land. Improving sales have been offset by increasing input costs. Subsidy payments assist financial performance, but ESA prescriptions effectively prevent increased production.
